Interface Player


  • public interface Player
    Player objects represent players in the game: they select their move based on the Board they are given and which side of the board they are playing. They may quit the game before a result is decided. Results are decided by the Game. You need to provide two implementations of this interface, one called HumanPlayer, which acts under control of the user, and one called ComputerPlayer which plays automatically and as well as it can within the time constraints. Input from the human players and output to the players can be redirected with in and out. Your Player should always use in and out for input and output rather than System.in and System.out. A default contructor with no parameters is required for each imeplementation of the interface. By default the input should be set to System.in and the output stream to System.out

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMove(Board b, int playerNum)
      Computer player moves should take less than one second to complete the getMove method or they forfeit the game.
      boolean isComputer()
      returns true is this is a computer player.
      void setIn(java.io.InputStream in)
      set the input stream for human commands (house numbers and QUIT).
      void setOut(java.io.PrintStream out)
      set the output stream for board state

    • Method Detail

      • getMove

        int getMove(Board b,
            int playerNum)
     throws QuitGameException
        Computer player moves should take less than one second to complete the getMove method or they forfeit the game.
        Parameters:
        b - An copy of the game that the player may experiment with. It should be a copy of the game so that the computer cannot cheat and experiments do not affect game play.
        playerNum - the number of the player: 1 or 2.
        Returns:
        the position of the house selected (counting anti-clockwise): a value in the range 1..6
        Throws:
        QuitGameException - if, instead of choosing a house, a human player chooses to quit by entering 'QUIT'. If a computer player throws QuitGameException they forfeit the game (isComputer()).

      • isComputer

        boolean isComputer()
        returns true is this is a computer player. Computer players are limited to one second per move (on E216 computers) and forfeit the game if they quit or make an invalid move.

      • setIn

        void setIn(java.io.InputStream in)
        set the input stream for human commands (house numbers and QUIT).

      • setOut

        void setOut(java.io.PrintStream out)
        set the output stream for board state
